results.title: Five Years After Peace Deal, Colombia Is Running Out of Time, Experts Say
results.abstract: A treaty with rebels in 2016 called for the end of a decades-long war. But that is not the same as achieving peace, and the window for doing so may be closing.
results.byline: By Julie Turkewitz and Federico Rios
des_facet: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

Zhengzhou, China, three days after the record-breaking downpour in July. Nearly eight inches of rain fell on the city in a single hour.

results.title: A federal appeals court delays New York City’s vaccine mandate for teachers.
results.abstract: The mandate, which affects well over 150,000 people working in the nation’s largest school system, was set to go into effect on Monday at midnight.

results.title: Affluent, Anxious and Almost Normal: A Journey Through Merkel’s Germany
results.abstract: As Germany heads into an election that will see Angela Merkel step down after 16 years as chancellor, she leaves behind a country profoundly changed — and anxious about changing more.

results.title: Whales So Close You Can Touch Them: A Family Adventure in Canada
results.abstract: Recalling a prepandemic trip to a watery landscape in Quebec province: “The adventure we had feels like one plucked from a world I can no longer reach, not unlike watching the water, waiting for a whale to crest.”

multimedia.caption: In the province of Quebec, near Tadoussac — a picturesque town where the Saguenay meets the St. Lawrence River — whale-watching is a serious endeavor. Above, a humpback whale in the St. Lawrence River.
